DataElement.preferredName: Last Menstrual Cycle Occurrence Month Year Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date relating to the last period from onset of last menstrual bleeding (menstruation) in an ovulating woman.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to the last period from onset of one menstrual bleeding (menstruation) to the next in an ovulating woman.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:Regularly recurring physiologic changes in the endometrium during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminating in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. The hormonal changes that lead up to a woman's having a period. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days.

Concepts.definition: Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.

The Menstrual Cycle involves regularly recurring hormonal changes and physiologic endometrial changes during the reproductive period in human females, and some primates, and culminates in partial sloughing of the endometrium (menstruation) in the absence of fertilization. For most women, one cycle takes 28 days. (NCI)

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the six character date as month, ane of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar, and year, the period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun as designated by the Gregorian calendar, mm/yyyy, date that an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar.  It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.:The period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun; a period of time containing 365 days.:a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: One of the 12 divisions of a year as determined by a calendar. It corresponds to the unit of time of approximately to one cycle of the moon's phases, about 30 days or 4 weeks.
A period of time that it takes for Earth to make a complete revolution around the sun, approximately 365 days; a specific one year period.
The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: What was the last date of menstrual bleeding

DataElement.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
